contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox kommune | name = Rennesøy | native_name = | native_name_lang = | other_name = | official_name = | idnumber = 1142 | image_skyline = Askjesundet bru.jpg | county = Rogaland | district = Ryfylke | capital = Vikevåg | demonym = Rennesøybu | language = [[Norwegian language|Neutral]] | coatofarms = Rennesøy komm.svg | munwebpage = www.rennesoy.kommune.no | mayor = Jostein Eiane | mayor_party = [[Christian Democratic Party (Norway)|KrF]] | mayor_as_of = 2003 | area_rank = 413 | area_total_km2 = 65 | area_land_km2 = 65 | area_water_percent = 0.02 | population_as_of = 2009 | population_rank = 256 | population_total = 3921 | populationpercent = 0.07 | population_density_km2 = 51 | population_increase = 26.0 | latd = 59 | latm = 6 | lats = 4 | longd = 5 | longm = 43 | longs = 55 | utm_zone = 32V | utm_northing = 6555899 | utm_easting = 0312855 | geo_cat = adm2nd }} {{Historical populations |footnote = '''''Source''': [http://www.ssb.no/english/subjects/02/02/folkendrhist_en/tables/tab/1142.html Statistics Norway].<ref>[http://statbank.ssb.no/statistikkbanken/Default_FR.asp?PXSid=0&nvl=true&PLanguage=0&tilside=selecttable/hovedtabellHjem.asp&KortnavnWeb=folkfram Projected population - Statistics Norway]</ref><ref>Per 1 January 1965, 1142 Rennesøy and 1143 Mosterøy were merged to one municipality, 1142 Rennesøy.</ref> |shading = off |1951|1483 |1961|1418 |1971|2045 |1981|2363 |1991|2578 |2001|3168 |2011|4202 |2021?|5961 |2031?|7639 }} '''Rennesøy''' is a [[Municipalities of Norway|municipality]] in [[Rogaland]] [[Counties of Norway|county]], [[Norway]]. It is part of the [[traditional districts of Norway|region]] of [[Ryfylke]]. The administrative center is the village of Vikevåg. The parish of ''Rennesø'' was established as a municipality on 1 January 1838 (see [[formannskapsdistrikt]]). [[Mosterøy]] was separated from Rennesøy on 1 July 1884. It was, however, merged back with Rennesøy on 1 January 1965 (but without [[Kvitsøy]]). ==General information== ===Name=== The [[Old Norse]] form of the name was ''Rennisøy''. The meaning of the first element is unknown and the last element is ''øy'' which means "[[island]]". Before 1918, the name was written "Rennesø". ===Coat-of-arms=== The [[Coat of arms|coat-of-arms]] is from modern times. They were granted on 20 February 1981. The arms show two [[crosier]]s. In the present municipality one of Norway's oldest and best preserved [[Monastery|monasteries]], [[Utstein Abbey|Utstein]], is situated. Hence the choice for the crosier.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ngw.nl/int/nor/r/rennesoy.htm|author=Norske Kommunevåpen|year=1990|title=Nye kommunevåbener i Norden|accessdate=12 October 2008}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{commonscat-inline|Rennesøy}} *{{wti|Rennesøy}} *[http://www.ssb.no/english/municipalities/1142 Municipal fact sheet] from [[Statistics Norway]] *{{Wikivoyage-inline|Rogaland}} {{Rogaland}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rennesoy}} [[Category:Municipalities of Rogaland]] [[Category:Villages in Rogaland]] [[Category:Rennesøy| ]]
